Welcome to MathML.js’s documentation!¶

“MathML is a low-level specification for describing mathematics as a basis for machine to machine communication which provides a much needed foundation for the inclusion of mathematical expressions in Web pages.” (From http://www.w3.org/Math/)

MathML.js is a Open Source (GLPv3) Javascript library to enable GRAPHIC humam manipulation of MathML elements (see the proof of concept or it version for Firefox OS and download it from here). This work is based on

  • TouchOfMath,
  • Equation Exercise Demo (proof of concept) and
  • Implementation of Dynamic Algebra in Epsilonwriter from Jean-François Nicaud and Christophe Viudez.

MathML.js ISN’T:

  • a plataform for display of mathematics in all browsers (try MathJax),
  • a equation editor (try Mathway),
  • a jquery-like Javascript library for MathML (try jquery-mathml);
  • a math Javascript library (try Math.js);
  • a symbolic math Javascript library (try Symbolic-Math-Library-for-Javascript).
